page.title: 09WILDLIFE ON BREAN DOWN-PART1
page.content: ONE OF THE FIRST BIRD SANCTUARIES WAS ESTABLISHED ON BREAN DOWN BY THE R.S.P.B IN 1912.IN SUMMER IT IS HOME TO MANY NESTING BIRDS.SKYLANES AND MEADOW PIPITS AT THE MOST ABUNDANT,WITH STONECHAT TITS AND MANY OTHER SPECIES. JACKDAWS HAVE THEIR NESTS IN HOLES IN THE CLIFFS WHILST ROCK PIPITS NEST ON ROCKS NEAR THE SEA.KESTRELS NEST ON THE CLIFFS EACH YEAR.ALTHOUGH GULLS AND STARLINGS NEST ON STEEPHOLME THEY COME TO ONE DOWN TO FEED. IN AUTUMN THOUSANDS OF BIRDS MIGRATING SOUTH STREAM PAST BREAN DOWN AND MAY STOP HERE TO SPEND A NIGHT OR TO AVOID ROUGH WEATHER.FROM AUGUST TO THE END OF OCTOBER MIGRATS CAN BE SEEN ON THEIR WAY TO WINTER IN SPAIN OR AFRICA. AGAIN IN SPING BREAN DOWN PROVIDES A REFUGE FOR BIRDS MOVING BACK TO THE NORTH TO NEST.
